reports.description: A study using our data finding that, from March to June, 2020, the COVID-19 case rate for incarcerated people was 5.5 times higher than the overall US population case rate. Their age-adjusted death rate was 3.0 times higher.
reports.author: JAMA Network
reports.title: COVID-19 Cases and Deaths in Federal and State Prisons

reports.description: A study from our team finding that life expectancy among people incarcerated in Florida state prisons has dropped by more than four years, from 77.9 to 73.8 years, during the COVID-19 pandemic.
reports.author: medRxiv
reports.title: Assessing the Mortality Impact of the COVID-19 Pandemic in Florida State Prison
